docs:
# How to create a bot and connect it to Facebook Messenger and Integromat

The Facebook Messenger app supports a connection of a bot that can then be used to send and receive messages on behalf of a designated page that belongs to the bot. 

![Scenario](https://integromat.zendesk.com/hc/article_attachments/360009138334/file.png)

The following steps are necessary for the correct setup.

1. Log into Facebook, navigate to [Facebook developer portal](https://developers.facebook.com/apps) and create a new app.

    ![New app](https://integromat.zendesk.com/hc/article_attachments/360009183793/file.png)
2. Once you create the app, you will be shown the Product Setup page. Select **Messenger** and click **Set up**. 

    ![Select messenger](https://integromat.zendesk.com/hc/article_attachments/360009183813/file.png)
3. Scroll down a bit on the displayed page until you see the **Webhooks** section. Click on **Setup Webhooks**. You will be promted to fill in a **New page subscription** form. The requested values can be generated through Integromat.

    ![Setup webhooks](https://integromat.zendesk.com/hc/article_attachments/360009183833/file.png)
4. Log into your Integromat account and create a new scenario. Add the module - **Facebook messenger- Watch messages** as the first module to your scenario. Click the **Add** button to create a new webhook. Enter a webhook name and a verification token of your choice into respective field. You will need this verification token later. Click **Save**. 

    ![Create webhook](https://integromat.zendesk.com/hc/article_attachments/360009138354/file.png)
5. Clicking the save button will generate an URL of the webhook. Copy this URL into your clipboard.

    ![Copy address](https://integromat.zendesk.com/hc/article_attachments/360009183853/file.png)
6. Go back to the **New page subscription** form. In the **Callback URL** field enter the URL from your clipboard and in the **Verify token** field enter the same token that you entered in step 4. In the **Subscription Fields** section,  select `messages` and `messaging_postbacks`and click **Verify and Save**. A green check mark next to the webhook indicates that the validation has run successfully.

    ![New subscription](https://integromat.zendesk.com/hc/article_attachments/360009138374/file.png)
7. Now you have to generate an access token for the bot. Go to the **Token generation** section (just above the Webhooks section) and select a page for which you want to generate the access token. Copy the generated access token into your clipboard.

    ![Token](https://integromat.zendesk.com/hc/article_attachments/360009138394/file.png)
8. To create a new connection between Integromat and Facebook messenger, go to the settings of the **Send a message** module and click the **Add** button. Enter the access token from the previous step into the respective field and click **Continue**.
9. As a last step, go back to the **Webhooks** setup section and select a page to subscribe your bot to the page events and click **Subscribe**.

Once you have set up a connection in both directions, you can finish your scenario.

![Completed](https://integromat.zendesk.com/hc/article_attachments/360009138414/file.png)

## Setting up developer roles

In order to test your application before publishing it, you need to set up roles for developers who will test it. For non-developer accounts, the app does not respond until it is officially released. For more information on how to set up the roles see the [official Facebook documentation](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/apps/test-apps). The settings of the roles is done in the the app settings in the left menu.

![Roles](https://integromat.zendesk.com/hc/article_attachments/360009138434/file.png)
name: facebook-messenger
label: Facebook Messenger

expect.help: Either PSID, phone number, or user_ref of the message recipient.
expect.name: id
expect.label: Recipient ID

sendMessage.name: sendMessage
sendMessage.label: Send a message

spec.help: Either PSID, phone number, or user_ref of the message recipient.
spec.name: id
spec.label: ID

spec.help: Phone number of the recipient with the format `+1(212)555-2368`. Your bot must be approved for [Customer Matching](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/messenger-platform/identity/customer-matching) to send messages this way.
spec.name: phone_number
spec.label: Phone number

spec.help: Providing a name increases the odds of a successful match.
spec.name: name
spec.label: Name

nested.help: Text or attachment must be set.
nested.name: attachment

nested.help: You can find more about templates in the [documentation](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/messenger-platform/send-messages/templates).
nested.name: payload
nested.label: Payload
Attachment

spec.help: You can get more information about quick replies in the [documentation](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/messenger-platform/send-messages/quick-replies).
spec.name: quick_replies

nested.help: URL of image to display on the quick reply button for text quick replies. Image should be a minimum of 24px x 24px. Larger images will be automatically cropped and resized.
nested.name: image_url
nested.label: Image URL

spec.label: Quick replies

expect.help: You can get more information about messaging types in the [documentation](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/messenger-platform/send-messages/#messaging_types).
expect.name: messaging_type
expect.label: Messaging type

nested.help: You can get more information about message tags int the [documentation](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/messenger-platform/send-messages/message-tags).
nested.name: tag
nested.label: Tag

watchmessages.name: watchmessages
watchmessages.label: Watch messages
watchmessages.description: Triggers when a new message is received.

getSenderDetails.name: getSenderDetails
getSenderDetails.label: Get Sender Details

expect.help: Map a PSID (page-specific ID) to get information about the user.
expect.name: userId
expect.label: User ID

getSenderDetails.expectJsonc:
[
	{
		"name": "userId",
		"type": "text",
		"label": "User ID",
		"required": true,
		"help": "Map a PSID (page-specific ID) to get information about the user."
	},
	{
		"name": "locale",
		"type": "boolean",
		"label": "Retrieve locale",
		"required": true,
		"default": false,
		"help": "May require additional permission `pages_user_locale`."
	},
	{
		"name": "timezone",
		"type": "boolean",
		"label": "Retrieve timezone",
		"required": true,
		"default": false,
		"help": "May require additional permission `pages_user_timezone`."
	},
	{
		"name": "gender",
		"type": "boolean",
		"label": "Retrieve gender",
		"required": true,
		"default": false,
		"help": "May require additional permission `pages_user_gender`."
	}
]

spec.help: Only attachments that were uploaded with the is_reusable property set to true can be sent to other message recipients.

spec.label: Is reusable?

uploadAttachment.description: Uploads assets that can be sent in messages at a later time.
